intro: Satureja alpina var. vuachensis, commonly known as alpine savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications due to its pungent, savory aroma. This variety is closely related to other members of the Lamiaceae family, sharing similar growth habits and chemical compositions.
